body.description: One A Day Men's Pro Edge offers a wide variety of key nutrients. One A Day Men's Pro Edge is a complete multivitamin with antioxidant Vitamins C and E to help meet the increased needs caused by moderate to intense physical activity. This daily multivitamin contains key nutrients like B Vitamins and Magnesium. One A Day Men's Pro Edge Multivitamin is formulated to support: physical energy by helping convert food to fuel, activity, and healthy muscle function. Adults should take one tablet daily, with food. One A Day Multivitamins can provide nutritional support that you and your family may need at every life stage.This statement has not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good multivitamin for active young men
reviews.reviewText: My son has been an athlete since he started soccer at age 3.I’ve tried all types of vitamins for him over the years and when he hit high school and started football, we switched from one a day teen formula to this.He’s now 20 and works out 5 days a week and has a job that keeps him moving and lifting.These are his vitamins of choice.He doesn’t complain of an after taste and they aren’t small, but not as big as many vitamins out there, that are a challenge to get down.They aren’t pricey and he is healthy.They’re a keeper.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2023
reviews.reviewText: It's difficult to find a multivitamin with no iodine. The price isn't too high compared to the others I've found.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Bought for significant other at the time who was a truck driver. He took them everyday for energy to keep him going. I’d say they worked well for him.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Overall a good multi-vitamin. I appreciate the extra B Vitamins. They aren't lying about "take with food" though, I swallowed one then took my dog for a walk without downing a Clif bar first and I tell you I was extremely uncomfortable by the time we'd knocked out a few miles. Also the pill is on the large side & uncoated so it can be tricky to swallow if it goes sideways.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2023
Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2019
reviews.reviewText: I know vitamin supplement effectiveness is debatable, but the way I look at is, "why not?" Its like an insurance policy. I track my diet closely and noticed a trend of being short on several micronutrients all included in the 1 a Day multivitamins. If the body DOES absorb the nutrients, its a win. If not, the cost is worth it just in case it is an effective supplement. Saying that, I honestly do feel better when taking the Pro Edge multivitamin. I feel that I recover faster from workouts and have better energy throughout the day. For any active guys out there looking for a good multivitamin, give these a shot.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Magnesium - No other multi vitamin has more Magnesium
reviews.reviewText: Magnesium. I'm 40 years old and pretty active. My entire life I've been prone to calf strains (Charlie Horses). That's where you get that intense pain in the upper calf and your muscle balls up into this huge hard mass. I used to get them alot (about once a year) I haven't now in 5 years. It's probably because I'm very conscious of drinking alot of water both before and during activity, but I attribute some of the credit to these little pills. For those who don't know, water, magnesium, and potassium are the three ingredients muscles need to contract and relax efficiently. Potassium is hard to supplement because you can overdose on it and vitamin pills will never have more than a very small percentage of your RDA. Fortunately, it is easy to get a good supply from everyday foods without thinking much of it. I used to get magnesium pills but when I saw these, I figured why not? You get 50% of your magnesium RDA which is enough for me. Make sure it's the Pro Edge not the regular "One a Day". I have scanned all the other multivitamins at the drug store and none of them come close to 50% RDA for magnesium.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2023
